subject: Law
title: Express vs. Implied Terms
description: A fast breakdown of Express vs. Implied Terms for builders.

hook.text: Your lease says rent is $1,500 a month. It doesn't say the landlord must provide running water. But they must.

buildup.text: Express terms are explicitly stated by the parties. Implied terms are read in by law or custom.

discovery.text: Courts imply terms to fill gaps: good faith dealing, reasonable time for performance, and fitness for purpose.

twist.text: Implied terms can override what the contract is silent aboutâ€”but rarely override express terms.

climax.text: The UCC implies a warranty of merchantability in every sale by a merchant, even if the contract is silent.

punchline.text: What the contract says matters. What it doesn't say can matter more.

quiz.question: What are implied terms in a contract?
options: Terms the parties explicitly agreed to
Terms read in by law or custom
